Irish and Commonwealth but not most EU citizens in UK included and many UK citizens in EU, even taxpayers, excluded -all also likely much affected. “Votes for Life” also in ToryManifesto: lost in rush for any kind of 'Leave'!

Lords Report 2009 UK Referendums=significant drawbacks; most appropriate on Fundamental Constitutional issues; stress good public information provision if to be fairly debated. Commend use of independent body.

Divided Party=easy tactical job/result not as hoped=FIASCO
attributes.background:
Current Right to Vote in General Election FRANCHISE totally wrong for a Referendum on UK/EU relationship – see below

INFORMATION meagre for proper assessment of arguments.

 Referendum gave NO MANDATE FOR ANY BREXIT. This is not about legalities but relevance, principle and common sense.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you mean by "hold a better referendum" if it is not already covered by an existing petitions such as:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/245960
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/237168
